intro: Arabis boryi, commonly known as the Bory's rockcress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, rounded seed pods that split open to release seeds. Arabis boryi is often found in open, sunny areas and is adapted to cold, harsh climates.
